section.para: This module enables you to view the current status of various Fee Payments that were initiated. You can initiate a new Fee Payment for a Facility. A deal consists of one or more facilities. A deal is structured for a company by a bank or group of banks to meet the company's financial needs.
To use the modules in Lending Services, your company must have arranged a deal with the Issuing Bank.

section.title: Fee Payments Landing Page
section.para:
The Fee Payments Landing page displays a list of Fee Payments transactions, the transactions are displayed in multiple tabs based on the current status of transaction. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.
The following image illustrates the Fee Payments landing page:

listitem.para:
Use this option to initiate a new fee payments for the desired Facility. This function displays a list of deals and related facilities, from which you can select a facility for which the fee is to be paid.The facilities are listed based on the deals user has access to.
The Fee Payment initiation feature is available only to maker user.

section.para: The Fee Payments listing page segregates transactions based on their current status like Draft, Pending Approval, Pending at Bank or Acknowledged. The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual transaction based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:

note.para: Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.

entry.para: Tab
Description

Lists all the Fee Payments transactions in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.

The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.

section.para: The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Status, Deal, Facility, Channel Reference, Fee(s), Effective Date, Currency. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant Fee Payment records. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed loan records:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of Fee Payment transactions.
CSV Download: Download the list of Fee Payment transactions displayed on the dashboard.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed Fee Payment transactions.

section.para: This section describes all the actions that you can perform on Fee Payment transactions. The actions are available in relevant tabs based on the ribbon you are on.

listitem.para: Actions are based on the user persona, like a maker user will have the action Edit (update an existing transaction), View (view the details of the individual transactions), Details (view the full details of the transactions), Discard (delete an existing draft transaction).

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para: This section describes the information presented on clicking the details button against any given transaction:

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the Transaction Details and Additional Information, which shows customer attachments, if any. The information is spread over two tabs, individual tabs are described below:
Transaction Details: Displays the details of Fee Payments transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab opens details in read-only mode.
Additional Information: Lists the 'Customer Attachments' added as part of this transaction.

You can perform following actions on the opened transactions:
Fee Payments Landing: You can navigate back to Fee Payments Landing page.
Journey: You can view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
